newsitem.title: USA: Sharp launches new pocket Zaurus.
newsitem.headline: Sharp launches new pocket Zaurus.

text.p: Sharp Electronics Corp said it is launching the Zaurus ZR-3000, a new pocket-sized handheld computer device bundled with software to synchronize with Microsoft Corp's Windows 95 operating system.
The ZR-3000 is expected to sell at retail stores for around $399, Sharp said, and will be capable of sending and receiving electronic mail and synchronizing with scheduling programs.

The machine weighs under 11 ounces, but offers both keyboardand touch screen interfaces wtih a 320 by 240 pixel screen and an optional fax modem, and communicates with Windows 95-equipped personal computers via an infrared port.
A fax modem is available for around $99.

In May, Osaka, Japan-based Sharp Corp said it was introducing into the Japanese market its M-10 Color Zaurus, which featured a bright 5-inch color TFT LCD screen capable of displaying over 65,000 colors.
